alert.note: Alert for Northern Fulton; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fulton and southeastern Herkimer Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 654 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dolgeville, or near Little Falls, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dolgeville, Ephratah, Caroga Lake, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Oppenheim, Fairfield, Ingham Mills, Crum Creek, Curtis, Lotville, Rasbach Corner, Doxtater Corner, Burrell Corners, Fical Corners, Shedd Corners, Scotchbrush, Phipps Corners, North Bush, Garoga and Glasgow Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Fulton; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer
